sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  import { Playground, PropsTable } from 'docz'
import Avatar from './index';

export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"avatar"}}>{`Avatar`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Avatars are useful for chat UIs, profile pictures and account photos.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"basic-usage"}}>{`Basic usage`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Use the `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`src`}</MDXTag>{` and `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`alt`}</MDXTag>{` prop to define the image to show. The `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`size`}</MDXTag>{` prop sets the size, medium is the default.`}</MDXTag>

<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"initials"}}>{`Initials`}</MDXTag>
